title: Ten ways to avoid the bug that’s (probably) going around your office
text:
In the words of John Snow, winter is coming: experts are warning Britain to brace itself for the coldest in 60 years. The national flu vaccination campaign has highlighted the vaccine as the best defence against flu, which can be a serious illness for at-risk groups such as over 65s and pregnant women, who receive it gratis (although anyone can pay £12.99 to get it at their local pharmacy).

But what else can the average office worker do to stay healthy this autumn and winter, avoiding not just the flu but also the dreaded colds going around like wildfire? How can you avoid catching the germs of your colleague who is suffering, martyr-like, while coughing and sneezing their germs all over the...
